intro: Sideroxylon mascatense, commonly known as the Arabian ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often clustered in dense inflorescences. Sideroxylon mascatense is valued for its durable wood and has been traditionally used in construction and tool-making in its native region.
